benchmark_details.name: ENZYME
benchmark_details.overview: ENZYME is a dataset designed for hierarchical text classification (HTC), comprising 30,523 articles from PubMed for predicting Enzyme Commission (EC) numbers, featuring a four-level single-path hierarchy.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for developing and benchmarking models for hierarchical text classification, particularly in the domain of biomedical literature.

data.source: Articles from PubMed with associated Enzyme Commission numbers.

methodology.calculation: Micro-F1 and Macro-F1 scores calculated based on predicted and actual hierarchical labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in classifying hierarchical labels.
methodology.baseline_results: HiGen outperforms existing methods with Micro-F1 of 92.61 and Macro-F1 of 84.15 on ENZYME.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments across ENZYME, WOS, and NYT datasets.
